method: Cook the bow tie pasta according to package instructions.
In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the cooked bow tie pasta to the skillet, along with the chili powder, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Toss the pasta in the spice mixture until well coated.
Transfer the seasoned pasta to a baking dish and top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F for 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove the pasta from the oven and top with black beans, diced tomatoes, and sliced jalapeños.
Serve the bow tie nacho delight with sour cream, guacamole, and salsa on the side.
Enjoy the cheesy and flavorful party snack!
